content: teddy sweater pattern design by merri purdy materials list 150 200 yards yarn leftovers i used red heart boutique unforgettable for project in photo size h crochet hook stitches/abbreviations used bpdc back post double_crochet chain chain fpdc front post double_crochet single_crochet single_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch gauge 10 stitches and 7 row = 2 inches pattern notes  overall finished dimensions body width = 6 height from shoulder seam to bottom hem = 5  front and back post double_crochet stitches add a nice stretchy ribbing to this sweater and will likely stretch to fit most medium sized teddy bears the teddy in the photo is a 15 classic vermont teddy bear  fpdc sts are always worked around fpdc sts of the previous round likewise bpdc sts are worked around bpdc sts of the previous round  size and gauge will vary depending on yarn selection and hook size  the chain 2 at the beginning of each round does not count as a stitch  the body of the sweater is worked in the round with sleeves crocheted directly onto work to give you a seamless finished piece  if you are using multiple colors for your sweater attach new color through the top two loops of any fpdc then ch2 and complete as directed you can crochet over your cut strands or weave them in at the end  foundation can be chained instead of using foundation double_crochet by chaining 52 then double_crochet in 3rd chain from hook and across to the end 1 body this section measures 6 wide by 2 ¾ high foundation/row 1 leaving a starting tail of 5 6 inches complete a foundation row using foundation double_crochet for 50 sts join with a slip_stitch to the top of first fpdc st you will stitch up the gap from the join in the finishing section round 2 chain 2 fpdc in first st bpdc in next st around to the end 25 fpdc/25bpdc altogether join with a slip_stitch to top of first fpdc round 3 10 repeat round 2 arm shaping round 11 chain 2 fpdc/bpdc in established ribbing pattern for 17 sts ending with a fpdc chain 11 skip 9 sts join chain with a fpdc in next stitch and continue with bpdc/fpdc in established ribbing pattern for next 16 sts chain 11 and then join with a slip_stitch to the top of the first fpdc st in the round you have just made two arm holes neck shaping round 12 chain 2 fpdc in first st bpdc in second stitch and continue in ribbing pattern through 17th st double_crochet in next 11 chain sts fpdc/bpdc for next 17 sts double_crochet in next 11 chain sts slip_stitch to join 56 sts total for this round round 13 - 16 chain 2 fpdc/bpdc in established ribbing pattern around to end join with a slip_stitch to the top of first fpdc round 17 chain 1 single_crochet 2 together 2xs decrease made single_crochet next 9 sts sc2 together
